transportAdvice: Shanghai has an extensive metro network that covers most major tourist areas and is easy to navigate with English signage; buses are also widely available but less tourist-friendly. Taxis and ride-hailing services are plentiful, and central areas like the Bund and French Concession are very walkable.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional frost; pack warm layers for outdoor sightseeing.
Still cold with increasing rain; Chinese New Year brings festive atmosphere but crowded attractions.
Mild and gradually warming but frequently overcast and damp; a light jacket is essential.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming flowers; rain showers are common so carry an umbrella.
Warm and increasingly humid with regular rain; one of the more comfortable months for sightseeing.
Hot and very humid with frequent heavy rain; the plum rain season brings prolonged wet spells.
Peak summer heat with high humidity and occasional typhoon-related storms; stay hydrated outdoors.
Continues hot and humid with typhoon risk; indoor attractions are a welcome relief from the heat.
Gradually cooling but still warm and humid; typhoon season lingers into early September.
Crisp and comfortable autumn weather; one of the best months to visit with clear skies and mild temperatures.
Cooling noticeably with dry and pleasant conditions; a good time for walking the city before winter sets in.
Cold and dry with festive holiday decorations; warm clothing is necessary for extended time outdoors.
